The post [Faster loading for GitHub Issues](https://github.blog/changelog/2026-01-22-faster-loading-for-github-issues) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
EnhancedContent:
GitHub Issues are now significantly faster with 35% of issue views occurring in under 200ms, up from 2% at the start of the year.

This is the first in a series of performance improvements we’re shipping to make GitHub Issues, and GitHub more broadly, feel instant.

## Availability

These performance improvements are live today on github.com. In order to benefit from them, **you must be signed in**. No configuration or opt-in is required.

You can experience these improvements through:

- [The repository index](https://github.com/cli/cli/issues)
- [Your “Issues” dashboard](https://github.com/issues/assigned)
- [A GitHub Project](https://github.com/orgs/github/projects/4247)

We’re working on bringing these improvements to additional pathways.

## Let us know what you think

Join the [GitHub Community](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/184858) to share your feedback.
Author: Allison
Title: Faster loading for GitHub Issues
